newsitem.title: UK: Abbot unit in Caspian Sea drill study.
newsitem.headline: Abbot unit in Caspian Sea drill study.

text.p: Britain's Abbot Group said on Friday that its wholly-owned subsidiary KCA Drilling Ltd has been awarded a contract by Azerbaijan International Operating Company to execute a drilling study on three fields in the Caspian Sea.
Abbot said the study began on December 9, 1996 and is expected to take 12 weeks.
Abbot is conducting the study along with a unit of Canada's Dreco Energy Services Ltd for the next phase in the development of the Gunashli, Chirag and Azeri fields.
Azerbaijan International is a consortium of 11 international oil exploration groups.
The study is being done in Dreco Europe's London office with support from KCA's corporate office in Aberdeen and Dreco's corporate office in Edmonton.
